reviews.review: Has a ton of balance issues, but still a ton of fun. Would recommend.

No es un mal juego, puedes pasar unos ratos entretenidos.
Sin embargo, la comunidad es muy t√≥xica, el juego tiene muchos errores y problemas en la jugabilidad y muchas veces te puedes sentir timado, por lo que solo recomiendo este juego si estas dispuesto a entrar en un competitivo poco accesible o si te sobra dinero y vas a jugar 3 veces en tu vida.

Look this game isn't perfect, but I really think that the good of this game outweighs the bad. It's 4v1 game-play is fresh and fun 5 years after its release and I think that a lot of people don't really think about how well this game balances it. Yes there are still some unfair mechanics on both sides but it is impressive how well it works. The game may not be perfect but is sure is fun.

Edit: I still truly believe what I said in this review, though it goes through rough patches DBD is still one of my favorite games. Its still fun over 1500 hours in and if that doesn't say something i don't know what will

Overall fun and also a source of my rage that'll probably take me to an early grave. Either way, playing with friends makes it better, but sometimes you'll great great solo matches. It's pretty random what kinda game you'll get, but typically you'll find decent matches. Just watch out for the games where it turns out you're playing against your teammates as well,

played as newbie, for 20 games, lost 19 games, super unbalanced game for newbie, and this is my first time not recommending a game, what a trash game, please consider seriously before purchasing this game, if you can accept continuously losing in this game in early, then it is okay.

Devs never really cared about the game.  There's paragraphs about the gameplay's balancing issues and the dev's being smartasses.  This goes from the infamous Hag pvp, all the way to today with the Freddy rework since the devs can't be bothered to keep in a unique mechanic and see how to make it work.  They are deaf to the community on what killers should be made and arrogant in thinking they  know whats best all while showing they are nothing short of incompetent.  Nepotism can be blamed for their lack of communication, again, look up the long novels of history the devs have if you want a good time.  Most of my time was idle, grind, or just trying to get past hilarious bugs.

EDITP:  I had this game reviewed already but Steam likes to be trash.  Not going to write another wall of text so this shorter review gets my point but you can look up all the fun facts on your own.

This game has changed a lot over the past few years and it is great to see the developers updating and adding content. I usually do not play by myself unless I am playing as the killer. In my opinion, this game is more fun with friends. I would recommend this game however you should not take it seriously. My biggest advice, take this game with a grain of salt. There will most likely be a lot of matches that you won't escape as the survivor or even win as the killer. Do not be that person who disconnects after a down, try to be a team player :)

I got banned but still good

Dead by Daylight is the equivalent of continually hitting yourself in the face with a tennis ball but wanting to keep playing tennis because you don't like other sports. 
This is  a VERY fun game when it's working, but is prone to a host of bugs and could use with a complete overhaul of some features. The gameplay is typically enjoyable, but if playing alone you'll have the most enjoyment as a killer, otherwise you should hope to have a friend or two that's willing to survive with you.
Whilst holding one button for a long time on a generator can feel boring, running with a killer, losing them in a chase or saving other survivors can be a very rewarding experience.
This is a great way to pass time between more demanding games and will likely have you laughing out loud with people; which is made even more possible due to its crossplay.                                                               The only flaw to this use of crossplay is its incredibly lengthy loading times - which you spend half of your time looking at.
Worth checking out and seeing if it fits your taste. 7.2/10
